newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti shares plunge, trigger suspension.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti shares plunge, trigger suspension.

text.p: Shares in troubled information technology group Olivetti were suspended automatically on the Milan stock exchange on Monday when they fell sharply to touch a 10 percent fluctuation limit.
The stock hit a fresh record low at 516 lire following news that magistrates in the town of Ivrea where Olivetti is based had put chief executive Francesco Caio under preliminary investigation.
Judicial sources said the investigation is a first step which could lead to a full-scale criminal investigation into public statements made by Olivetti on its finances.

Olivetti shares were offered at 515 lire (33 cents) , below 515.6 lire which was the maximum the price could fluctuate within the regular 10 percent oscillation limit above or below the previous closing price. They had been trading around 4.0 percent down on the day at 550 lire before the probe news.
Trading in the stock was expected to restart at 1145 GMT, the stock market council said.
Olivetti shares fell around 28 percent in two days early last week, repeatedly triggering automatic suspension as investors sold on nervousness over the state of the loss-making group's finances.
